        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/60ce07072e343e9dcef5e3ee244bc13b641dcc9f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/60ce07072e343e9dcef5e3ee244bc13b641dcc9f"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/60ce07072e343e9dcef5e3ee244bc13b641dcc9f<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>60ce07072e343e9dcef5e3ee244bc13b641dcc9f<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/60ce07072e343e9dcef5e3ee244bc13b641dcc9f"><!---->60ce07072e343e9dcef5e3ee244bc13b641dcc9f<!----></a><br>Author: Moe Ahmadi <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Moe Ahmadi &lt;<!----></span>mahmadi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mahmadi@chromium.org"><!---->mahmadi@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Oct 19 18:10:43 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Oct 19 18:10:43 2021<!----></span><br><br>[M96][realbox] Treat suggestion answers as text without HTML markup<span class="line"><!---->[M96][realbox] Treat suggestion answers as text without HTML markup<!----></span><br><br>The current implementation assumes that suggestion answers contain HTML<span class="line"><!---->The current implementation assumes that suggestion answers contain HTML<!----></span><br>markup and accounts for that when generating the a11y label for the<span class="line"><!---->markup and accounts for that when generating the a11y label for the<!----></span><br>match.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7095119c76ff55ed7e1706f6728cd98476e69f98<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7095119c76ff55ed7e1706f6728cd98476e69f98"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/7095119c76ff55ed7e1706f6728cd98476e69f98<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>7095119c76ff55ed7e1706f6728cd98476e69f98<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/7095119c76ff55ed7e1706f6728cd98476e69f98"><!---->7095119c76ff55ed7e1706f6728cd98476e69f98<!----></a><br>Author: Moe Ahmadi <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Moe Ahmadi &lt;<!----></span>mahmadi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mahmadi@chromium.org"><!---->mahmadi@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Oct 20 00:41:16 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Oct 20 00:41:16 2021<!----></span><br><br>[M95][realbox] Treat suggestion answers as text without HTML markup<span class="line"><!---->[M95][realbox] Treat suggestion answers as text without HTML markup<!----></span><br><br>The current implementation assumes that suggestion answers contain HTML<span class="line"><!---->The current implementation assumes that suggestion answers contain HTML<!----></span><br>markup and accounts for that when generating the a11y label for the<span class="line"><!---->markup and accounts for that when generating the a11y label for the<!----></span><br>match. This is expensive and may expose security vulnerabilities. This<span class="line"><!---->match. This is expensive and may expose security vulnerabilities. This<!----></span><br>CL changes that assumption and treats the suggestion answers as text<span class="line"><!---->CL changes that assumption and treats the suggestion answers as text<!----></span><br>without HTML markup.<span class="line"><!---->without HTML markup.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also makes sure that the client-side generated markup for the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also makes sure that the client-side generated markup for the<!----></span><br>match contents is used to render the suggestion answers. Note that the<span class="line"><!---->match contents is used to render the suggestion answers. Note that the<!----></span><br>match contents is a prefix of the answer's first line. Therefore the<span class="line"><!---->match contents is a prefix of the answer's first line. Therefore the<!----></span><br>match contents markup is applicable to the answer's first line.<span class="line"><!---->match contents markup is applicable to the answer's first line.<!----></span><br><br>For more info see <span class="line"><!---->For more info see <!----></span>crbug.com/1251541<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello Ashish, the VRP Panel did fully review the report and POC videos while assessing this report. The impact of this bug does not result in a universal XSS, but XSS solely on the NTP.  The impact of exploitation via this XSS bug does not allow for arbitrary JS execution universally across Chrome, thus warranting it a "universal XSS" and allowing for an attacker to extract a victim's gmail cookies, for example. <span class="line"><!---->Hello Ashish, the VRP Panel did fully review the report and POC videos while assessing this report. The impact of this bug does not result in a universal XSS, but XSS solely on the NTP.  The impact of exploitation via this XSS bug does not allow for arbitrary JS execution universally across Chrome, thus warranting it a "universal XSS" and allowing for an attacker to extract a victim's gmail cookies, for example. <!----></span><br>If you can demonstrate this level of exploitability via this issue, we would welcome that information and would be happy to reassess this issue. <span class="line"><!---->If you can demonstrate this level of exploitability via this issue, we would welcome that information and would be happy to reassess this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>
      
        <div class="container-outside" id="issue">
          <aside class="metadata-container">
            <mr-issue-metadata></mr-issue-metadata>
          </aside>
          <div class="container-issue">
            <div class="issue-header-container">
              <mr-issue-header></mr-issue-header>

              <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
<a class="__crdxFeedbackButton" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/monorail/issues/entry?template=Online%20Feedback"></a></body>


      
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:

                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
            </div>

                  <!---->:

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1251541: Security: Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS) - completing previously searched text in NTP
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1251541: Security: Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS) - completing previously searched text in NTP
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ashis...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/105876289" title="ashis...@gmail.com"><!---->ashis...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      ashis...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ashis...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Tue, Sep 21, 2021, 5:15 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 21, 2021, 5:15 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 21, 2021, 5:15 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1251541: Security: Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS) - completing previously searched text in NTP
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Sep 21, 2021, 5:15 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1251541: Security: Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS) - completing previously searched text in NTP
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br>Universal Cross-Site Scripting - UXSS is a type of attack that exploits client-side vulnerabilities in the browser or browser extensions in order to generate an XSS condition, and execute malicious code. When such vulnerabilities are found and exploited, the behavior of the browser is affected and its security features may be bypassed or disabled.<span class="line"><!---->Universal Cross-Site Scripting - UXSS is a type of attack that exploits client-side vulnerabilities in the browser or browser extensions in order to generate an XSS condition, and execute malicious code. When such vulnerabilities are found and exploited, the behavior of the browser is affected and its security features may be bypassed or disabled.<!----></span><br><br>Chrome Version:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version:<!----></span><br><br>Version 93.0.4577.82 (Official Build)<span class="line"><!---->Version 93.0.4577.82 (Official Build)<!----></span><br><br>Operating System:<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:<!----></span><br><br>Any OS with Google Chrome Browser installed.<span class="line"><!---->Any OS with Google Chrome Browser installed.<!----></span><br><br>Steps To Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps To Reproduce:<!----></span><br><br>Step1: Create a HTML file - see xss.html<span class="line"><!---->Step1: Create a HTML file - see xss.html<!----></span><br><br>Step2: This file contains the CSRF code to search in Google search bar with XSS payload as - "><img src=x onerror=alert(1337)><span class="line"><!---->Step2: This file contains the CSRF code to search in Google search bar with XSS payload as - "&gt;&lt;img src=x onerror=alert(1337)&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Step3: Send this File to Victim.<span class="line"><!---->Step3: Send this File to Victim.<!----></span><br><br>Step4: Once the request is submitted from CSRF attached html file.<span class="line"><!---->Step4: Once the request is submitted from CSRF attached html file.<!----></span><br><br>Step5: It will create a search result in Google search bar <span class="line"><!---->Step5: It will create a search result in Google search bar <!----></span><br><br>As soon as Victim goes to search bar to search anything XSS will get triggered.<span class="line"><!---->As soon as Victim goes to search bar to search anything XSS will get triggered.<!----></span><br><br>Request you to please go through my attached POC,<span class="line"><!---->Request you to please go through my attached POC,<!----></span><br><br>POC: <span class="line"><!---->POC: <!----></span>https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PrQ1dP3JAWfkJMDqKTV6DJNoHaUlqabr?usp=sharing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PrQ1dP3JAWfkJMDqKTV6DJNoHaUlqabr?usp=sharing"><!---->https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PrQ1dP3JAWfkJMDqKTV6DJNoHaUlqabr?usp=sharing<!----></a><br><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span><br>Thank You<span class="line"><!---->Thank You<!----></span><br>Ashish Arun Dhone<span class="line"><!---->Ashish Arun Dhone<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS) - completing previously searched text in NTP
          (was: Security: Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS))
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">

        Hello Team,<span class="line"><!---->Hello Team,<!----></span><br><br>What I have observed is, <span class="line"><!---->What I have observed is, <!----></span><br><br>Say Victim is using "Laptop A" suppose victim open xss.html file --> click submit --> open the NTP --> Click in Search Box and XSS will get triggered. <span class="line"><!---->Say Victim is using "Laptop A" suppose victim open xss.html file --&gt; click submit --&gt; open the NTP --&gt; Click in Search Box and XSS will get triggered. <!----></span><br><br>Now if victim uses "Laptop B" and login with same Google account which he is using in "Laptop A" then victim just have to Click in Search Box and same XSS will get triggered irrespective of any system as this XSS payload is getting stored in history and this will create more impact.<span class="line"><!---->Now if victim uses "Laptop B" and login with same Google account which he is using in "Laptop A" then victim just have to Click in Search Box and same XSS will get triggered irrespective of any system as this XSS payload is getting stored in history and this will create more impact.<!----></span><br><br>Thank You!!<span class="line"><!---->Thank You!!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 18<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1251541#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mahmadi@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/950600386" title="mahmadi@chromium.org"><!---->mahmadi@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mahmadi@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mahmadi@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Oct 11, 2021, 9:09 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Oct 11, 2021, 9:09 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1251541#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Oct 11, 2021, 9:09 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1251541#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Oct 11, 2021, 9:09 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        This is resulting from the way the aria-label is computed by assigning the match content to a temporary element's innerHTML in [1] in order for the text content to be extracted. innerHTML renders the HTML markup allowing for any scripts in the match content to execute. Note that this does not happen with inner-h-t-m-l Polymer binding in [2] since the DOM being injected into has already been parsed.<span class="line"><!---->This is resulting from the way the aria-label is computed by assigning the match content to a temporary element's innerHTML in [1] in order for the text content to be extracted. innerHTML renders the HTML markup allowing for any scripts in the match content to execute. Note that this does not happen with inner-h-t-m-l Polymer binding in [2] since the DOM being injected into has already been parsed.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not 100% positive if match content can contain HTML markup (useful markup for styling and not XSS) and why the decision was made at the time to use innerHTML to sieve out the markup. A safer alternative to using innerHTML will be using textContent with the caveat that if the match content does contain markup those will appear in the value for the aria-label attr. I will send out this fix shortly. <span class="line"><!---->I'm not 100% positive if match content can contain HTML markup (useful markup for styling and not XSS) and why the decision was made at the time to use innerHTML to sieve out the markup. A safer alternative to using innerHTML will be using textContent with the caveat that if the match content does contain markup those will appear in the value for the aria-label attr. I will send out this fix shortly. <!----></span><br><br>The next step will be to verify if matches do not contain useful markup and whether this indirection can be avoided entirely.  <span class="line"><!---->The next step will be to verify if matches do not contain useful markup and whether this indirection can be avoided entirely.  <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/realbox/realbox_match.js;l=291,297;drc=e4dcd712f358ef167da95e0b960d3512a7896c8d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/realbox/realbox_match.js;l=291,297;drc=e4dcd712f358ef167da95e0b960d3512a7896c8d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/realbox/realbox_match.js;l=291,297;drc=e4dcd712f358ef167da95e0b960d3512a7896c8d<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/realbox/realbox_match.html;l=111,113;drc=e4dcd712f358ef167da95e0b960d3512a7896c8d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/realbox/realbox_match.html;l=111,113;drc=e4dcd712f358ef167da95e0b960d3512a7896c8d"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/realbox/realbox_match.html;l=111,113;drc=e4dcd712f358ef167da95e0b960d3512a7896c8d<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 23<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1251541#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        I changed the title of the CL to something less conspicuous.<span class="line"><!---->I changed the title of the CL to something less conspicuous.<!----></span><br><br>To add more context, the logic to sieve out HTML markup was added in<span class="line"><!---->To add more context, the logic to sieve out HTML markup was added in<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/2965565<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2965565"><!---->crrev.com/c/2965565<!----></a> in M93 when support for suggestion answers was added to the NTP realbox.         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1251541#c27">Comment 27<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Oct 12, 2021, 4:03 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        follow up to #26, looking at the other other entry points, Omnibox in [1] and CrOS app list in [2],  the *additional text* of the answer's first line is being appended to the match contents if one exists and second line of the answer is used as is as the description which is consistent with what the Realbox does in [3]. I couldn't find any indication that the additional text of the answer's first line contains any of its own markup. I think we should continue using that on the JS side as if it's just text and take advantage the client-side generated markup for the match contents to render it. Note that the match content is a prefix of the answer's first line the way it's implemented in the realbox, thus the match contents markup will be compatible with it.<span class="line"><!---->follow up to #26, looking at the other other entry points, Omnibox in [1] and CrOS app list in [2],  the *additional text* of the answer's first line is being appended to the match contents if one exists and second line of the answer is used as is as the description which is consistent with what the Realbox does in [3]. I couldn't find any indication that the additional text of the answer's first line contains any of its own markup. I think we should continue using that on the JS side as if it's just text and take advantage the client-side generated markup for the match contents to render it. Note that the match content is a prefix of the answer's first line the way it's implemented in the realbox, thus the match contents markup will be compatible with it.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>http://shortn/_QmF48SHHGm<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://shortn/_QmF48SHHGm"><!---->http://shortn/_QmF48SHHGm<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>http://shortn/_Kf7doqIMaY<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://shortn/_Kf7doqIMaY"><!---->http://shortn/_Kf7doqIMaY<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>http://shortn/_7F7QmUm0of<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://shortn/_7F7QmUm0of"><!---->http://shortn/_7F7QmUm0of<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/10939d3c6653ef2cc8105bb4145db6a876c22e61<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/10939d3c6653ef2cc8105bb4145db6a876c22e61"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/10939d3c6653ef2cc8105bb4145db6a876c22e61<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>10939d3c6653ef2cc8105bb4145db6a876c22e61<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/10939d3c6653ef2cc8105bb4145db6a876c22e61"><!---->10939d3c6653ef2cc8105bb4145db6a876c22e61<!----></a><br>Author: Moe Ahmadi <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Moe Ahmadi &lt;<!----></span>mahmadi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mahmadi@chromium.org"><!---->mahmadi@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Oct 13 00:51:56 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Oct 13 00:51:56 2021<!----></span><br><br>[realbox] Treat suggestion answers as text without HTML markup<span class="line"><!---->[realbox] Treat suggestion answers as text without HTML markup<!----></span><br><br>The current implementation assumes that suggestion answers contain HTML<span class="line"><!---->The current implementation assumes that suggestion answers contain HTML<!----></span><br>markup and accounts for that when generating the a11y label for the<span class="line"><!---->markup and accounts for that when generating the a11y label for the<!----></span><br>match. This is expensive and may expose security vulnerabilities. This<span class="line"><!---->match. This is expensive and may expose security vulnerabilities. This<!----></span><br>CL changes that assumption and treats the suggestion answers as text<span class="line"><!---->CL changes that assumption and treats the suggestion answers as text<!----></span><br>without HTML markup.<span class="line"><!---->without HTML markup.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also makes sure that the client-side generated markup for the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also makes sure that the client-side generated markup for the<!----></span><br>match contents is used to render the suggestion answers. Note that the<span class="line"><!---->match contents is used to render the suggestion answers. Note that the<!----></span><br>match contents is a prefix of the answer's first line. Therefore the<span class="line"><!---->match contents is a prefix of the answer's first line. Therefore the<!----></span><br>match contents markup is applicable to the answer's first line.<span class="line"><!---->match contents markup is applicable to the answer's first line.<!----></span><br><br>For more info see <span class="line"><!---->For more info see <!----></span>crbug.com/1251541<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1251541" title="Security: Universal Cross-Site Scripting (UXSS) - completing previously searched text in NTP"><!---->crbug.com/1251541<!----></a><br><br>Fixed: This is expensive and may expose security vulnerabilities. This<span class="line"><!---->match. This is expensive and may expose security vulnerabilities. This<!----></span><br>CL changes that assumption and treats the suggestion answers as text<span class="line"><!---->CL changes that assumption and treats the suggestion answers as text<!----></span><br>without HTML markup.<span class="line"><!---->without HTML markup.<!----></span><br><br>This CL also makes sure that the client-side generated markup for the<span class="line"><!---->This CL also makes sure that the client-side generated markup for the<!----></span><br>match contents is used to render the suggestion answers. Note that the<span class="line"><!---->match contents is used to render the suggestion answers. Note that the<!----></span><br>match contents is a prefix of the answer's first line. Therefore the<span class="line"><!---->match contents is a prefix of the answer's first line. Therefore the<!----></span><br>match contents markup is applicable to the answer's first line.<span class="line"><!---->match contents markup is applicable to the answer's first         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello Ashish, the VRP Panel did fully review the report and POC videos while assessing this report. The impact of this bug does not result in a universal XSS, but XSS solely on the NTP.  The impact of exploitation via this XSS bug does not allow for arbitrary JS execution universally across Chrome, thus warranting it a "universal XSS" and allowing for an attacker to extract a victim's gmail cookies, for example. <span class="line"><!---->Hello Ashish, the VRP Panel did fully review the report and POC videos while assessing this report. The impact of this bug does not result in a universal XSS, but XSS solely on the NTP.  The impact of exploitation via this XSS bug does not allow for arbitrary JS execution universally across Chrome, thus warranting it a "universal XSS" and allowing for an attacker to extract a victim's gmail cookies, for example. <!----></span><br>If you can demonstrate this level of exploitability via this issue, we would welcome that information and would be happy to reassess this issue. <span class="line"><!---->If you can demonstrate this level of exploitability via this issue, we would welcome that information and would be happy to reassess this issue. <!----></span><br>Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        <h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        <form id="convertIssueForm">
          <div class="input-grid">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;
    }

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          
            Close
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open issue in new tab<span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    x<kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b>:<span class="line"><!---->:<!----></span><br><br>Universal Cross-Site Scripting - UXSS is a type of attack that exploits client-side vulnerabilities in the browser or browser extensions in order to generate an XSS condition, and execute malicious code. When such vulnerabilities are found and exploited, the behavior of the browser is affected and its security features may be bypassed or disabled.<span class="line"><!---->Universal Cross-Site Scripting - UXSS is a type of attack that exploits client-side vulnerabilities in the browser or browser extensions in order to generate an XSS condition, and execute malicious code. When such vulnerabilities are found and exploited, the behavior of the browser is affected and its security features may be bypassed or disabled.<!----></span><br><br>Chrome Version:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version:<!----></span><br><br>Version 93.0.4577.82 (Official Build)<span class="line"><!---->Version 93.0.4577.82 (Official Build)<!----></span><br><br>Operating System:<span class="line"><!---->Operating System:<!----></span><br><br>Any OS with Google Chrome Browser installed.<span class="line"><!---->Any OS with Google Chrome Browser installed.<!----></span><br><br>Steps To Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps To Reproduce:<!----></span><br><br>Step1: Create a HTML file - see xss.html<span class="line"><!---->Step1: Create a HTML file - see xss.html<!----></span><br><br>Step2: This file contains the CSRF code to search in Google search bar with XSS payload as - "><img src=x onerror=alert(1337)><span class="line"><!---->Step2: This file contains the CSRF code to search in Google search bar with XSS payload as - "&gt;&lt;img src=x onerror=alert(1337)&gt;<!----></span><br><br>Step3: Send this File to Victim.<span class="line"><!---->Step3: Send this File to Victim.<!----></span><br><br>Step4: Once the request is submitted from CSRF attached html file.<span class="line"><!---->Step4: Once the request is submitted from CSRF attached html file.<!----></span><br><br>Step5: It will create a search result in Google search bar <span class="line"><!---->Step5: It will create a search result in Google search bar <!----></span><br><br>As soon as Victim goes to search bar to search anything XSS will get triggered.<span class="line"><!---->As soon as Victim goes to search bar to search anything XSS will get triggered.<!----></span><br><br>Request you to please go through my attached POC,<span class="line"><!---->Request you to please go through my attached POC,<!----></span><br><br>POC: <span class="line"><!---->POC: <!----></span>https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PrQ1dP3JAWfkJMDqKTV6DJNoHaUlqabr?usp=sharing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PrQ1dP3JAWfkJMDqKTV6DJNoHaUlqabr?usp=sharing"><!---->https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PrQ1dP3JAWfkJMDqKTV6DJNoHaUlqabr?usp=sharing<!----></a><br><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span><br>Thank You<span class="line"><!---->Thank You<!----></span><br>Ashish Arun Dhone<span class="line"><!---->Ashish Arun Dhone<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
